reviews.review_msg: Easiest course I have taken.

Despite his thick accent and his weird use of english phrases, the lectures we're actually quite clear. But he will shine the spotlight on you every now and then. Overall, this is a pretty easy course, but his exams are much harder than they need be and rely on small things he mentioned in passing during lecture.

This professor has to be one of the worst profs i have EVER taken. just by looking at him he seems scary and rude even though not too much. Sometimes makes things harder than they need to be. this course is easy but he made is hard as hell. His exams are brutal and unfair; avoid taking him. you don't wanna get a bad grade on an easy course!

Seriously, this guy scares me. He pretty much bellowed at everyone during the midterm where to sit. He's alright in class if he follows his notes. A word of advice, don't try to use your brain.I found a simple way to solve some very hard problems, and justified my reasoning. I got 0.I inquired, and he was VERY unreasonable and wouldn't listen to me
This guy has a poor attitude towards students... he doesn't care about you at all. And his teaching is sucks!
Hard, then I have nothing to say.
bad attitude towards students.  his exams are okay
This guy is simply brutal. His altitude towards students is as bad as you can get. Don't take his class
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Hard,,,,
bad attitude towards students!!
No Comments
No Comments
Impossible mid-term.
Hard. That's what I can say.
I agree that his assignments are easy but long, and the midterms and final are hard.
I can't believe it's a 300 level course.
No Comments

His accent isn't all that bad, but he's so focused on getting through the material that he rushes through without taking time to really teach. But, when he's covered the day's material and sees that he has extra time, he'll explain everything in a nice, clear "summary" that's really worth catching. So just hope he runs ahead of schedule, every day.

I used to think that as long as I tried hard enough myself, it doesnt matter how bad the proof is. This doesnt work at all for his class. No examples at all given to the class. The textbook doesnt provide any example either. No help from TA. AVIOD HIM !!!

He's not great at teaching but he's a good "teacher". I had to mostly self learn and it was hard since solutions aren't posted but I felt he cared about students and tried to make our life easier. He was lenient with grading as well and changed the course structure to 3 quizzes + project instead of a 40-50% final which I found extremely helpful.

That textbook he uses couldn't have gotten any worse. how can you put a bunch of examples 0 solutions? There is not even a clear explanation written in the book that you can follow to understand how to solve the question. He is such a bad prof, teaching math without writing anything on the board just like a philosophy class reading the slides

In math teaching, visual component is vital. The prof is virtually not writing anything helpful during the post-midterm revision. You virtually cannot receive anything helpful from his pure-oral instruction.

The worst professor you will ever see. No replies to your email and his lectures are horrible. Don't ever take his classes and If you do, teach yourself if you wanna even pass. His notes are not useful and his assignments take forever and they are really hard. if you ever take his class you will hate yourself for that. stay away from him.
Online classes-- Unresponsive and unhelpful. No preparation or direction given before midterms or exams. Expect an entirely self-taught course.

Don't choose this professor. He doesn't do anything at all. His notes often skip steps or give only one final answer. The problem that should have been solved in 10 minutes will take you several hours.

He is the worst professors I've ever seen. In the online class, there are no videos or lectures (he only answers questions instead of giving notes. But he doesn't turn on the camera or share his screen, he just dictates complex questions by mouth.) He only posts notes, but these notes are very unclear and have many errors that he never fixes.

He's a newer lecturer, but he cares a lot about the success of his students. Very clear communication throughout the semester, and very clear lectures. He makes sure to take the time to answer all the questions put his way. The assignments are pretty hefty, hours of work, but they prepare you really well for the midterm and the quizzes.

It was his first time teaching this course, so the explanations fell flat. Filled lecture slides were not posted until right before the midterm, and before the final due to odd reasoning. Not too hard overall but boring. Also handwriting was like chicken scratch.
good quality

Luis isn't the best professor when it comes to organization. He would show up to our lectures late and teach beyond the allotted time. His lecture slides were clear and his exams were relatively fair. However, throughout the semester we barely received any feedback which is my biggest complaint - we still haven't gotten our first midterm marks back

The course itself was fine, he was late starting and ending each lecture though.

The real problem is that we never got any grades on assignments and midterms. I did the final today and the 2nd homework (due Feb 9th) was only just graded. It was not a pleasant experience having no idea how I was performing in the class for the whole semester.

Decent lectures that started 5 minutes late (great opportunity to make some class friends). Notes were pretty helpful. The exams were fair and based more on application than theory (and proofs). The biggest challenges were communication - it took over a month to get our first test back.
Late for class every single time. Nothing was organized. Solutions post days after his promise. TA also marking extremely hard.

Luis was only on time a handful of times and even when he was on time he wasn't prepared. Almost every single lecture starts 5-10 mins late and he doesn't respect the time at which the lecture is supposed to end. He will often go off on tangents in the middle of lectures and it is not uncommon to only get through a few slides of the lecture. Avoid.

He tries to make the material more approachable to the non-math ppl but it didn't turn out well. He worries too much about the colour of pens than the material. Should post assignment solutions. Terrible text, prof who doesn't communicate the material well, great TA though.
X

Masood was really good in terms of teaching, his accent was one area where he lacked, other than that he was very good. His exams were moderate in terms of difficulty level, would highly recommend him and would love to take another course with him,

He's a really nice guy and cares abt his students but teaching is really not for him. I would learn everything before lecture from the textbook but then go to lecture and get extremely confused about a topic I had already learned ... avoid to say the least ...

He reads off his slides and does a very poor job at explaining & that's why less than 30% of students attend his lectures. Exams are long , difficult and confusing. Exams, assignments and lectures are not fairly related & he doesn't provide sources for extr practice. He has a strong ego and is not open to feedback. Avoid if possible.

The professor makes the lecture really boring. He literally just reads off the lecture slides and his voice wants to make me fall asleep. When asking him a question, he sometimes doesn't answer directly and gives you more irrelevant information making you more confused. No sense of humour. His tests are extremely long for the time allotted.
Good !
Difficult exams and homework marking is super stingy. Prof can't explain anything clearly

"You know..yeah...you know...right!" you are going to be hearing this all the time! Wrote on the board with like 12 font, so his writing is difficult to see and read. Very difficult to understand too. Better off reading the book at home. His exams are fair though. Would recommend a diff prof though if you wanna learn.
super nice guy, notes and ideas were often very convoluted. Gave long round about confusing explainations
